page.title: 16Living Memory Brockhampton
page.content: My Great Grandfather came as a tenant to Lincetter Farm in 1903.In 1919 he bought the farm from Mr Lutley of Brockhampton. My great Grandmother made enough bread in one day to last the family a weeks supply.Butter was always made on a Wednesday to be taken to Bromyard on Thursdays by horse and trap to keep the butter cool in the summer time.It was put in a bread basket and lowered down into the well. Rhubarb leaves were often used to pack round it for its journey to Bromyard market.During the war years farmers were made to plough up more ground to grow more food shuch as corn,sugar,beet and potatoes. The old people worked very long hours no half days and no pay.
